page.title: 06Crime Prevention in Culcheth
page.content:
We try to stop crime in Culcheth in a number of ways. One is called 'Homewatch'. In a Homewatch area people ask their neighbours to keep watch on their home when they are out. If anybody sees something suspicious they call the Police in. There are Homewatch areas all over the country, helping to reduce the number of burglaries. Cycle coding is another means of crime prevention. It has been done outside the CPS supermarket in Culcheth. The Police stamp your post code into the metal of your bicycle frame. You then get a sticker with 'Coded Cycle' written on. This goes on your bike to discourage thieves from taking it.
Mark Lomas
